Description:
What an opportunity!
Often sought but seldom found, a modern elevated home just an easy stroll to the beautiful gourmet strip within the township of Creswick. Take in peaceful views & stunning sunsets from this contemporary classic.
* In close proximity to both Daylesford & Ballarat town centres, enjoy the best of both worlds
* Spacious open plan living & dining flow through to an outer deck, ideal for entertaining
* Central sparkling bathroom
* Enjoy year round comfort with ducted heating
* Spacious 764sqm approx. allotment with 2 street frontages gives room to further transform STCA
* The gardens are a blank canvas, ready for you to make your very own
*St Georges Lake & walks all an easy amble away & monthly farmers market is a highlight for serious foodies
Insights: 32 Rogers Street, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2016 and 45 other 3 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
3.25HA (8.03 Acres) Moyola Circa 1936. An Exceptional Lifestyle Offering
Of double brick construction in a coveted and tightly held location within 30km of Ballarat's CBD, Moyola is a truly rare offering and is guaranteed to impress the most discerning lifestyle buyer and is now offered for genuine sale after four generations of family ownership. Carefully re-decorated and retaining its highly appealing period features the home accommodates separate formal lounge and dining rooms, three spacious bedrooms, two bathrooms and study. A modern fully appointed chefs kitchen features stainless steel appliances, stone bench tops and ample cupboard and bench space. Year round comfort is assured with the options of wood fires or reverse cycle heating and cooling via a modern split system. Outside the home features wide surround verandas a modern 16M x 6M shed which incorporates DLUG, and fully lined rumpus room complete with reverse cycle and bar. Fenced into two main paddock with improved pastures and water is delivered by both tank and stock and domestic bore this property is ideal lifestyle buyer wanting a property proximate to Ballarat.

Description:
Picturesque Setting on 48 Acres
Situated in the popular Blampied locale this property encompasses all aspects of your escape to the country lifestyle of picturesque outlook, comfortable modern home and acreage ideal for sheep, cattle or horses.
Set in a private setting with superb panorama views to the lights of Maldon, rolling hills and beyond, this property is set on 48 acres of rich red volcanic soil well set up for stock into 7 main paddocks all fed via trough or from 2 large dams.
The home has been renovated with modern well-appointed kitchen, 3 spacious bedrooms with 4th bedroom off outdoor entertaining area, lounge with built in unit and separate family room.
Externally the property has extensive shedding including bungalow with shower and toilet facilities, stables, machinery sheds and large stock shed and is completed with ample tank and dam water, solar/wood/elect hot water system and solar panels fed back into the grid and vegetable garden.
Situated within easy distance to Swiss Mountain Hotel and ease of access to both Ballarat and Daylesford, this property is certainly one to inspect.

Description:
A Very Tidy Home, In A Very Quiet Locale!
This is an exciting opportunity to secure a well-loved home, in a quiet street, yet only two minutes to the hub of town. The brick veneer holds three spacious bedrooms, each with BIR's. The formal lounge is blessed with great natural light and warmth. The abode has gas central heating and air-conditioning for all year comfort. While the polished floorboards add warmth also to the home. The low maintenance property is a fabulous first or retirement home, but also makes an ideal investment, especially with the high demand for leases in town. A return of approximately $260 p/w is expected.

Description:
Beautiful Renovation in Ideal Location
Perfectly located in a sought after tree-lined street of central Creswick, is this gorgeous three bedroom weatherboard home which has been extensively restored. Original period features adorn the home throughout, whilst essentials such as plumbing, wiring and roofing have been overhauled.
The home is stylish and contemporary in both design and dcor - 32mm blackbutt flooring along with tasmanian oak skirting boards and architraves create the foundation of a home with a modern, natural flow. All bedrooms have been splashed with a vibrant touch of colour, while the living area with designer curtains and double timber entry doors is open plan to work perfectly with the adjacent kitchen. Ample storage areas, along with Caesar Stone benches create a more than adequate space to delight your culinary skills whilst a freestanding stainless steel gas 900mm cooker compliments the overall space and other appliances.
The elegant bathroom provides a claw foot bath, pedestal vanity and separate shower, while the independent laundry and separate toilet keeps the entire family pampered. The interior has been entirely repainted with quality Dulux paint and the ceiling has been insulated with R4.1 ceiling batts, while all doors are commercial grade to provide solid durability. Natural gas ducted heating provides an even ambient temperature throughout while the fully functional open fire place in the lounge creates a further cosy feel, especially through the cooler months.
This huge allotment has vast potential to accommodate your personal landscaping touches.
The 1000+ m2 property includes prolific fruit trees (including quince and plum), established shade trees plus two raised vegetable gardens, garden edges and pathways. A 12 x 3m double garage with end to end vehicle coverage is accessed by the Tuscan aggregate driveway, while the fresh light colour of the home creates a beautiful street appeal.
Creswick is a thriving country town that offers community spirit, health and education facilities, and an increasing reputation for becoming a foodie's destination. With a quick 15 minute commute to Ballarat for additional lifestyle choices and the ever popular Daylesford only 20 mins away, this is a dream location!
Insights: 62 Napier Street, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2016 and 45 other 3 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
High Profit Potential in Creswick
In excellent shape and ready to go, this Davis Street home provides not only a fabulous lifestyle; it also provides an opportunity for an astute investor and/or a developer to work their magic into something special. Backing onto Hammon Street with a generous 1157m2, this property provides fabulous choices; a chance to live in a home with a generous landmass at your fingertips, extend (STCA), create a magnificent garden or consider a subdivision to the remainder of the yard for a profitable venture or future growth.
Framed by a number of established trees along with a gravel driveway and a single carport for vehicle protection, this weatherboard construction offers three good size bedrooms, an open design through the lounge along with a modern functional kitchen and an updated family bathroom. A strategically placed split system along with a free standing combustion heater create enough warmth to comfort the entire home, while the many windows and the home's significant elevation generates a cool breeze aiding the cross ventilation benefits. All bedrooms have been modernized with a number of various dcor elements while floors, walls and windows have been refreshed, the home offers a general fresh feel with a warm white and latte tone palette throughout.
The property also has the potential as an investment with a weekly rental in the vicinity of $240-$250, this home is set to one side of the allotment giving the perfect arrangement to add an extension or divide with ease (STCA). Ready for occupancy; this neat family home presents as a fabulous investment with Creswick's township just minutes away along with mountains of potential right at your back door. Call our agent today for further particulars.
Insights: 11 Davis Street, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2016 and 45 other 3 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
Four Picturesque Acres Of Lifestyle & Comfort
It is simply pleasant to stroll around this property. The four acres has on show lovely gardens, old trees, great shedding, animal shelters, stables, round yard and views of the countryside. The family sized home has room for all. There are three gracious bedrooms with a new ensuite to the master. An office lets you work from home. The abode has a formal lounge, formal dining, a casual living room and a dining open plan to the kitchen. The outlook from this functional kitchen is delightful. There are new floor coverings and a solar system helps keep bills to a minimum. All this just four minutes back to the hub of town. Oh... the serenity.

Description:
Substantial Price Reduction! Vendors Relocating Overseas And Must Sell!
It is our pleasure to introduce you to Willow Springs - a beautiful property set in a very tightly held location within easy commutable distance to Ballarat, Melbourne and Daylesford and offering a multitude of possibilities. Presiding over an idyllic 71 acres with stunning views of beautiful rolling hills, green pastures and manicured gardens from literally every room in the house. This property lends itself to many rural or business pursuits with its expansive home, land and infrastructure creating an opportunity as a potential wedding venue, bed and breakfast, prestigious equestrian property, Gallery, Restaurant or simply a beautiful place to live. From the moment you step foot in the door you will be impressed with the quality of the home with no expense spared to ensure the upmost quality and comfort is provided. The home is teaming with natural light throughout and the floor plan is flexible with how it can be used. The home consists of Timber floors, white plantation style shutters, open plan living and dining area, mud room and study, open Jetmaster fireplace with sandstone hearth which is a real showpiece of one of the two main living areas. Central heating & reverse cycle air conditioning. Entertaining is a delight in the granite kitchen with its stainless steel gas range, plenty of storage space and centre island bench. The bedrooms are generous in size, all with direct access to the gardens and decking. The master bedroom, also pairing as a parents retreat with its own nursery or study, huge walk through robe and ensuite with doors to your own private deck. All of the hard work has been done, simply move in and enjoy.
Externally, everything you could want in a country property is on hand. There is a huge 4 car garage/machinery shed with high clearance doors, concrete floor and power (approx. 18m x 8m), cattle yards with easy access via a sealed road, 5 well fenced paddocks and 2 dams. For the horse enthusiast, there is a 60' x 30' dressage arena, sheltered paddocks and a fantastic stable complex featuring hot and cold water, electricity, 3 individual stalls, tack room and feed bin. The water supply to this property is sensational with a 4 meg stock and domestic license offering clean bore water with a flow rate that will ensure you will never run short of water. There is a 10,000 litre rainwater tank as well as approx. 22,000 litres of bore water storage. If looking after the entire property isn't for you, you may consider leasing all or part of the acreage for cropping, stock or horse agistment. This has provided the current owners a passive income which more than covers your rates and other costs that you may need to cover throughout the year! Wander down the tree lined driveway, enjoy the beautiful, established and private gardens, tend to your well fed stock or simply kick back on the private decking areas and enjoy watching your kids roam around in clean country air. This property is one of the most stunning and admired properties in the district and offers further potential to be the go to place in Blampied for whatever you choose to make of it. No matter what you choose to make of it, you will feel like you are going to your own piece of paradise.
With the recent price reduction of over $100,000, the vendors have shown that they are motivated to sell the property in order to move overseas. This property represents tremendous value in the marketplace.
Insights: 489 Daylesford-Clunes Road, Blampied VIC 3364 was last sold in 2016.

Description:
Top Class Townhouse In Quiet Location
Set in a quiet complex of three townhouses, this exclusive ensemble of distinctive residences, blend traditional and modern to create a sophisticated three bedroom urban home. Surrounded by other well established homes and benefitting from proximity to the many amenities and facilities of the thriving township of Creswick, this home offers a contemporary edge with a low maintenance advantage and views over distant forest.
High quality carpets and slimline double window furnishings add to the energy efficiency, while the neutral tones and practical finishes add to clean lines and functionality of its cosy floor plan. The kitchen provides the most impact, with a feature brick wall adding a textured statement to the ample cupboards and drawers, while the practicality of the island bench doubles as a serviceable breakfast bar or preparation space. The dining area and living room flow on perfectly from the kitchen area to provide one fabulous room for open conversations and family get-togethers.
A lavish bathroom boasts a full size bath, elongated vanity and porthole window, along with a feature tiled shower and separate toilet for further convenience. The master is designed with built in robes and direct access to the bathroom, while the two other bedrooms and independent laundry offer built in robes and linen press for additional storage capacity. Ducted floor heating keeps your toes toasty and warm with the beneficial effect of hot air rises' for overall warmth. NBN also newly connected ready for use.
A low maintenance pebble garden features to the front with a very private fully fenced paved courtyard with raised centre garden is on show to the rear. Vehicles are well covered with a double lock up garage with a practical internal access for home coming safety. This piece of real estate is a very practical and low maintenance acquisition that retirees, first home buyers and/or professional couples could easily enjoy. Speak to our agent as soon as possible about the fabulous features and inspection times of Unit 1/12 Bell Street.
Insights: 1/12 Bell Street, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2016.

Description:
4.77 ha Bush Block (approx 11.7 acres)
If you enjoy getting out of the city for a weekend of camping, gold detecting and/or dirt bike riding, this may be the block for you. Just a short drive to historic gold mining towns of Talbot and Clunes with Maryborough your major shopping centre. Located in the Pyrenees Shire, is an easy drive to surrounding wineries.
For more information please call Jo Millar on 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers on 0437 456 908

Description:
Impressive From Front To Back!
Looking for a country home offering something for all family members? BIRCH HAVEN is a charming and idyllic property nestled in the township of Kingston only a short drive to Daylesford or Ballarat and just over an hours drive to Melbourne. Birch Haven is a grand home, quality built from naturally beautiful Castlemaine Stone. Sitting on approx. 1.5 acres of established and relaxing gardens made possible by rich volcanic soil and potable bore water supply. Town water and rain water also supply this property. Sit under the trees and take in the picturesque views in every direction across the countryside.
This is an ideal country home and includes all the features you would expect from a quality home. This splendid property offers:
- 3 double bedrooms, 1 with en-suite
- Main bathroom with full-size claw foot bath
- 2 toilets
- Huge lounge/sitting with separate dining
- Lead light entrance and other feature windows
- Combustion heater and gas ducted heating
- Fully equipped bright kitchen with ample cupboards and island bench
- Large Laundry
- Wrap around verandah
- Outdoor paved and undercover entertaining area
- Large Garage with Kitchen/shower/toilet and mezzanine floor to current model train layout and attached carport
- New American barn (12 x 7m) with hoist
- Free standing studio/craft room
- To the rear of the block is a truly distinctive entertainment area complete with replica old hotel and bluestone fire-pit for year round entertainment
- Undercover parking for 8 vehicles
This property has all the charm and features that a quality country lifestyle property should have and an inspection will more than impress the most discerning buyer.
Insights: 400 Kingston Road, Kingston VIC 3364 was last sold in 2016.

Address: 1255 McCallums Creek Road Red Lion VIC 3371
Description:
Great Block with Views
On approximately 13 acres, enjoy the benefits of all that country life has to offer with 360 degree views, seasonal creek and a State Forest boundary with walking & bike riding tracks to explore. Ideal for gold detecting or simply watch the native wildlife graze. The property features a 3 bay lock up shed which makes the most of comfortable camping or possible outdoor spa experience with a bit of imagination (detailed list of inclusions available upon request). An extra open bay houses a 4 bed caravan including gas/electric fridge and gas stove. Year round water supply is taken care of with a 5,000 ltr tank plus bore (1,000 litres per hour).
Zoned Rural Living, this property has the Land Capability Assessment already done. Power & phone at front of property.
Getaway from the rat race and make this your own piece of paradise today. Only 15 mins to Maryborough, 10 mins to Clunes and 40 minutes to Ballarat.
To arrange inspection please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301

Description:
Priced to sell !!! This homely 3 bedroom, 2 living areas, large outdoor entertaining area,man cave/shed is situated at popular Creswick.
Situated in popular Creswick close to walking and riding tracks is this very homely 3 bedroom brick property situated on a large block. the master bedroom has access to a two way bathroom. The bathroom has a shower and a bath.
On entering the house you find the formal lounge room which leads to an open plan kitchen/meals and second living area. The kitchen includes stainless steel appliances. The two other bedrooms have built in robes.
A sensational covered outdoor living area is provided and faces north capturing wonderful winter sun.
The property is cosy and comfortable in both winter and summer with ducted gas central heating and ducted cooling throughout.
The wide block allows for vehicle access to rear yard and the man cave. The man cave has been fully lined with an American barn theme and has to be seen to be believed.
"THINKING OF SELLING in the Ballarat area gsre real estate OFFERS up to $2500 of FREE advertising in the Ballarat Courier.

Description:
Romantic Creswick Cottage
The timeless faade of this romantic cottage is blended with the charming interior of this shabby chic home. Displaying a seamless blend of contemporary touches with elements of yesteryear, the cottage includes: detailed cornice, ceiling roses, fire surrounds and amazing 100year blue slate floors.
The property has been thoroughly renovated right through to ground level with: new stumps, re wiring, re plastered and freshly painted throughout. With three bedrooms, plus a home office/bedroom for further guests, an eclectic bathroom with lead light window and a further toilet for extra convenience, this home is all you will ever need. A desirable country kitchen with a 900 industrial style oven, timber cabinetry & floors and an original pot belly stove create a warm place for the family gatherings and the rear porch is fully enclosed creates another zone to relax in the sun.
A deep garden allotment with full private fencing is completed with a unique milking shed, 2 water tanks and a rustic chicken coop to create a home with character and charisma all rolled into one. Sitting on a 971m2 (approx quarter acre) this cottage has plenty of scope to extend or room to further build (STCA) and is sheltered by mature trees and a country garden. Rear access to crown land allows the opportunity to walk the beautiful surrounds of this quiet location, along with the proximity of many facilities just moments away.
With many attractions at your fingertips, including 30minutes to Daylesford and 15minutes to the city of Ballarat, this is a perfect place for a weekend retreat or a chic place to live just steps away from the thriving township of Creswick.
Insights: 41 Haines Street, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2016 and 14 other 4 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
A LITTLE BIT OF PARADISE.
Tucked away at the end of South St you'll find a quaint block of land of approx. 1800sq.m with a bountiful apple tree. It's the perfect patch of land for a couple of sheep or a pony. Sit and have a picnic and enjoy the surrounds or take a stroll along the Wallaby Track, part of the Great Dividing Trail - Creswick Miners Walk. The land potentially has sewer, power and water available. If you are looking at this land as a home site you should firstly contact Hepburn Shire regarding planning
To arrange your inspection please contact:
Ange Flowers on 0437 456 908 or
Alan Gay on 0417 570 977

Description:
Rural Delight in Kingston
With panoramic views across the rural landscape, this lifestyle property is located in Kingston, just three minutes from the buzzing township of Creswick and 15 minutes from the relaxing town of Daylesford. This location also offers a quick commute to Ballarat, as well as room to explore the surrounding district.
Enhanced by a well established front hedge, dual entrances, separate paddock, manicured gardens and various sheds, this property also boasts a separate bungalow. Of hardiplank construction, this home offers three bedrooms (two with built in robes) and a good size lounge with new carpet, and electric heating
A sun filled room is also available to relax or could be utilized as a home office. The open plan kitchen/diner provides picturesque views, along with ample storage and preparation space to accommodate family and friends. The timber cabinetry and laminate benchtops are durable and hardwearing for everyday use. The bathroom is functional with cosy carpet flooring with the added convenience of a separate shower situated in the laundry.
The bungalow is located to the rear of the property amid the established gardens. The convenience of both tank and town water is available, along with solar power energy. The entire 3615m2 offers a multitude of possibilities such as an ideal base for a small hobby farm, room for horses or large pets, along with a welcoming space for growing families or those just looking for room to move!

Description:
Reduce your carbon foot print in Bush setting on 10 acres
This charming, fully renovated, solar 3 bedroom, plus study home has you relaxing as soon as you arrive. Watch the native wildlife graze or simply enjoy the view while you relax on the entertainment deck. Set between Mt Glasgow & Mt Greenock you are only 4kms to historic Talbot
Includes:
Huge country style kitchen with feature Raeburn wood stove as well as gas cooktop
Living area features 2 way solid fuel heater to enjoy the comfort from living, lounge and dining area
French doors to open plan living with polished timber floors
Two way bathroom for en-suite access to main bedroom
Split system
Good Fencing, paddocks x3
22,000 litre Water Tank plus Dam
Inspection encouraged. Please call Jo Millar on 0438 081 301 to arrange an appointment.

Description:
Charming Home Overlooking Pretty Gardens & St Georges Lake
Picture yourself coming home and enjoying a walk around St.Georges Lake on the Lake Loop Walk on the way to the Spillway Lookout. After a stroll rest and relax in the shade of beautiful garden and across the bridge to your air-conditioned home. Views over acres of reserve land grant serenity and a fabulous sense of space. The formal lounge of the abode has amazing natural light while the more casual of living areas is open plan to the young kitchen and dining area. Bills are kept at bay with a 5.4k/w solar system. The strongest you can have. A car enthusiast will appreciate the double carport and double garage. Although it captures a country outlook, the residence is only 3 minutes to the hub of town.

Description:
Country Lifestyle On A Small Scale
Dating back nearly 100 years, yet offering a combination of modern facilities, this gorgeous country farmlet provides three good size paddocks, a stable, small shed and chicken coup. Set on approx. 3 acres, with prolific fruit trees and established gardens, this home offers three bedrooms, a family bathroom and a contemporary kitchen with loads of preparation and cupboard space. Updated some years ago, this area provides the chef with magnificent facilities with stainless steel appliances, timber finish cabinetry and marble-like black benchtops for a dramatic finish. The bedrooms have been decorated in vivid colours and cosy carpet, while the living room has timber floors and the original ceiling rose from years past.
The colorbond shed is connected to a water tank which provides excellent water storage, while a bore is on hand for unlimited water usage. A nearby shed creates the ideal place for horse enthusiasts with a stable and paddocks for protection and safety. There is also a double carport for vehicle or machinery cover.
This property is an ideal place for families looking for room to move, or for those just wanting a country lifestyle not far from the action. Newlyn is a lovely rural area in the Shire of Hepburn, with just 15 minutes drive to central Ballarat and 75 minutes North West of Melbourne via the Western Freeway. Call our agents today for further details of this quaint country home, which will give you a lifetime of peace and relaxation.
